SEARCH
Package control

Class AuthenticationController

java.lang.Object
control.BaseController
control.AuthenticationController
public class AuthenticationController extends BaseController
Controller responsible for authentication-related operations.

Loads user data from CSV sources and provides helper methods for validating credentials, registering company representatives, and changing passwords. Uses PBKDF2 with HMAC-SHA256 for secure password hashing.

    • login

      public User login(String userID, String password)
      Attempt to authenticate a user by id/email and password.

      Role resolution is attempted in this order: Student ID → Company Representative email → Staff ID. Role is determined by membership in the corresponding in-memory maps; email format is not used here. Company representatives must have status "Approved" to log in; students and staff have no status gate. Passwords are verified against PBKDF2 (HMAC-SHA256) hashes using constant-time comparison. On failure, a brief message is written to stderr ("Invalid password.", "Account not approved by staff yet.", or "Invalid user ID."). This method performs no rate limiting or account lockout.

      Parameters:
      userID - the login identifier (student id, staff id, or company rep email)
      password - plain-text password to verify against stored hash
      Returns:
      the authenticated User instance on success, or null on failure

    • register

      public Boolean register(String email, String name, String password, String companyName, String department, String position)
      Register a new company representative account (initial status "Pending"). The new account is put into the in-memory map and the company CSV is rewritten. Password is securely hashed using PBKDF2 before storage.
      Parameters:
      email - account email (also used as id)
      name - representative name
      password - plain-text password (will be hashed before storage)
      companyName - company name
      department - department name
      position - position/title
      Returns:
      true when the CSV rewrite succeeded; false otherwise

    • changePassword

      public boolean changePassword(User loggedInUser, String newPassword)
      Change the password for the given logged-in user.

      Updates the in-memory object with a newly hashed password and persists the change to the corresponding CSV.

      Parameters:
      loggedInUser - the user object whose password will be changed
      newPassword - the new plain-text password (will be hashed before storage)
      Returns:
      true if the password update and persistence succeeded, false otherwise

    • hashPassword

      protected String hashPassword(String password)
      Hash a plain-text password using PBKDF2 with HMAC-SHA256.

      Generates a random 16-byte salt and applies 65,536 iterations to produce a 256-bit hash. The result is formatted as "iterations:salt:hash" with salt and hash Base64-encoded. Each invocation uses a fresh salt.

      Parameters:
      password - the plain-text password to hash
      Returns:
      formatted hash string containing iterations, salt and hash

    • verifyPassword

      protected boolean verifyPassword(String password, String stored)
      Verify a plain-text password against a stored hash.

      Extracts the iterations and salt from the stored hash, recomputes the hash for the provided password, and performs a constant-time comparison.

      Parameters:
      password - the plain-text password to verify
      stored - the stored hash string in "iterations:salt:hash" format
      Returns:
      true if the password matches the stored hash, false otherwise

    • pbkdf2

      protected byte[] pbkdf2(char[] password, byte[] salt, int iterations, int keyLengthBits)
      Generate a PBKDF2 hash using the specified parameters.

      Uses PBKDF2 with HMAC-SHA256 algorithm to derive a key from the password and salt with the given iteration count and key length.

      Parameters:
      password - password characters to hash
      salt - salt bytes for the hash
      iterations - number of PBKDF2 iterations
      keyLengthBits - desired key length in bits
      Returns:
      byte array containing the derived hash
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if hashing fails due to algorithm unavailability or other errors
